entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from plate, feminine of plat flat, from Vulgar Latin *plattus, probably from Greek platys broad, flat place

def.dt: :a smooth flat thin piece of material
:forged, rolled, or cast metal in sheets usually thicker than 1/4 inch (6 millimeters)
:a very thin layer of metal deposited on a surface of base metal by plating
:one of the broad metal pieces used in armor
:armor of such plates
:a thin relatively flat anatomical part (as a lamina of bone) of an animal body
:scute
:the thin under portion of the forequarter of beef
:the fatty back part see beef illustration
:home plate
:any of the large movable segments into which the earth's lithosphere is divided according to the theory of plate tectonics
def.set: Middle English; partly from Anglo-French plate plate, bullion; partly from Old Spanish plata silver, from Vulgar Latin *platta metal plate, from feminine of plattus flat
def.dt: :a silver coin
:precious metal
:silver bullion
def.set: Middle English, from Anglo-French plat, plate dish, plate, from plat flat
def.dt: :domestic hollowware made of or plated with gold, silver, or base metals
:a shallow usually circular vessel from which food is eaten or served
:a quantity to fill a plate :plateful
:a main course served on a plate
:food and service supplied to one person a dinner at $10 a plate
:a prize given to the winner in a contest
:a horse race in which the contestants compete for a prize of fixed value rather than stakes
:a dish or pouch passed during collections
:a flat glass or plastic dish used chiefly for culturing microorganisms
:a prepared surface from which printing is done
:a sheet of material (as glass or plastic) coated with a light-sensitive photographic emulsion
:a metallic grid with its interstices filled with active material that forms one of the structural units of a battery
:license plate
:a horizontal structural member that provides bearing and anchorage especially for the trusses of a roof or the rafters
:the part of a denture that fits to the mouth
:denture
:a full-page illustration often on different paper from the text pages
:a schedule of matters to deal with have a lot on my plate now
:without having been earned :as a gift goals were handed to them on a plate
:to cover or equip with plate: as
:to provide with armor plate
:to cover with an adherent layer mechanically, chemically, or electrically
:to deposit (as a layer) on a surface
:to make a printing surface from or for
:to fix or secure with a plate
:to cause (as a runner) to score in baseball
:to arrange (food) on a plate
:rolled, ground, and polished sheet glass
:a rail or narrow shelf along the upper part of a wall for holding plates or ornaments

entry.fl: noun plural but singular in construction

def.dt: :a theory in geology: the lithosphere of the earth is divided into a small number of plates which float on and travel independently over the mantle and much of the earth's seismic activity occurs at the boundaries of these plates
:the process and dynamics of tectonic plate movement
:a similar process on a body other than earth
:a removable usually plastic dental appliance used in orthodontics and prosthodontics: as
:a device worn in the upper or lower jaw and used especially to reposition the jaw or prevent bruxism
:retainer 3b
:being a main course usually offered at a special price in a restaurant a blue plate luncheon
:a disk formed in the phragmoplast of a dividing plant cell that eventually forms the middle lamella of the wall between the daughter cells
